item.title: Xurri ko killed by a lion
item.summary: The death of a relative of the narrator from the bites of a lion, is told in the Katkop dialect by !kweiten ta //ken (L VI.-2. 4010-4013). !kweiten ta ||ken's father and a man called Xurri ko were out hunting quagga when a lion caught Xurri ko and bit him in the leg. Xurri ko died from the severity of his wounds.
item.comments: 1) p.4009v: !kweiten ta ||ken heard this from her mother and father (â‰ kamme-an and Xaa-ttin [presumably]); notes to this incident including the name of the place where it happened (Riet Kolk); Xurri ko was !kweiten ta ||ken's father's 'uncle' (or !koin), 2) p.4011v: lions bite people's shoulders and knees but not their heads, 3) This story is found in Book VI-2
item.author: !kweiten ta ||ken (Rachel) (VI)
